page.name: overview/eval-kit
page.summary:
The full Sparx Application Platform Release 2.0 can be downloaded for a free 30-day evaluation period. Although Sparx runs on both Unix based and Windows PC machines, the Developer Kit for evaluation is only for Windows at this time. A Unix based evaluation will be posted soon.
Please review the requirements first, make sure you have a JDK installed, then click here to download and run the evaluation kit.
The kit includes and automatically installs:
the Sparx Application Platform software
sample applications
an application server (a free developer version of Resin)
a pure Java database with JDBC driver (Hypersonic SQL)
PDF versions of printable tutorials
local copy of developer.netspective.com
all required open-source and third-party libraries
page.section:
Our Developer Kit for evaluation is bundled with several sample applications. The two simpler sample applications, called hello and library, can be run using the bundled (free) Hypersonic SQL Java database.
One of the larger samples is Cura, a web based project management application for demonstration purposes. If you plan to evaluate Cura on your own servers, you will need to install Oracle (version 8 or newer) on a server and make it available for access by the server that will have the Sparx Developer Kit installed. You can choose to install Oracle on the same server as the Sparx Developer Kit provided it has the resources to handle both an application server and a database server.

Sparx includes hundreds of pages of both online (HTML) and offline (PDF) documention. To get the most ouf the sample applications described below, please review the documents described below and follow along. Click here to learn about how to review the source code for the sample applications online if you have not downloaded the Sparx Evaluation Kit.
Document Samples Covered Purpose
Getting Started with Sparx All
Describes the two primary means for evaluating Sparx -- online and offline. Furthermore, it explains how to install Sparx onto your local servers and how to peruse the source code online.
Sparx Tutorial Hello, Library
Introduces Sparx by describing most of the functionality and walking the reader through the development of two full-scale sample applications hello and library (Hello World and Sparx Collection).
Advanced Sparx Tutorial Cura
Provides examples that demonstrate the advanced functions available in Sparx. This is primarily done by walking the reader through the implementation of sophisticated project management application called Cura.
